entry.title: the shovel talk
entry.summary:
Author: mikaminato

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,236Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 52

Summary: "Shovel talk?" Bruce asks, dragging the words out like he's wading through molasses, trying to split his attention between the computer calibrations and Steph's endless chatter. It's a losing battle. She jumps from topic to topic like she's on a trampoline, ignoring every subtle signal Bruce throws that screams, leave me alone with my numbers. "Of course," she says like it's the most obvious thing in the world, flopping into the chair next to him and twisting just enough to make Bruce want to teleport out of the room. "You're their father. Your sacred duty is to track down each boyfriend and threaten to bite their balls out with your teeth if they dare break their hearts."   (Or, Bruce tries to be a good parent and learns that is part of the procedure to give his sons' boyfriends the shovel talk. It goes amazing. (contains irony.))

entry.title: towards the sun
entry.summary:
Author: daddyjackfrost

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,254Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 110

Summary: “If New York doesn’t want me anymore,” he said into the dusk, the words not quite a prayer and not entirely a joke, “I wish to be someplace that does.” That's all it was, a simple wish. But magic is unpredictable and it's not done with Peter yet. Gotham wants Peter even though Peter doesn't want it. He's far from home with no way back in sight. All he can do now is build something tangible. Something real. It won't be easy, though. Not when his heart longs to be with those who have left him.

entry.title: Gods Don't Belong in Gotham
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 81,784Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 853

Summary: “Well?” he asked, his voice low.A pause.His eyes dragged over Clark, not with drunken lust but with something sharper.“You here to watch… or join? Might as well make it a threesome.”Clark choked on his own spit so hard he nearly doubled over, coughing. It's been 5 years since both Superman and Batman began their separate crusades. Both curious but cautious.Clark remains in Metropolis, respecting the Dark Knight's strict rule to keep metas out of Gotham. Meanwhile, Bruce is consumed with finding a balance between Batman and Bruce Wayne, determine to not repeat mistakes of the past. But it's hard to do that when he is too stubborn to accept help. Fortunately, for him Clark is just as stubborn.Their paths cross when Clark is sent to cover a gala in Gotham, stepping into the city he's barred from. What begins as a professional obligation turns into an unforgettable collision with Gotham's once reclusive billionaire. Or Clark and Bruce fall for each other slowly yet quickly.

entry.title: Just Another Cliché Story
entry.summary:
Author: DaniDany

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 82,744Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 328

Summary: Bruce Wayne didn’t want to attend that public high school with its worn-out halls, loud teenagers, and curious eyes that clung to his skin like needles. But Alfred insisted. “Make friends,” he said. “Spend time with kids your age.”As if age was the only thing they had in common.Bruce walked into that school expecting to remain invisible. He didn’t expect to see blue eyes looking back at him with a strange mix of kindness and danger. He didn’t expect someone like Clark to talk to him more than once. He didn’t expect... to feel.What followed wasn’t love at first sight. It was the collision of two worlds bound to fall apart—One built of steel.The other, of shadows.And even though he knew it would hurt, for the first time in years, Bruce Wayne didn’t run.

entry.title: Shared Space
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,009Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 16

Summary: When Clark Kent moves into Wayne Manor, the world’s finest heroes discover that saving the planet is easier than sharing a kitchen. Between Gotham’s endless gloom and Clark’s impossible optimism, domestic life becomes its own battlefield — complete with labeling wars, kitchen experiments, and Alfred’s silent judgment. As they navigate the delicate balance between sunlight and shadow, Bruce and Clark learn that compromise is its own kind of heroism. From arguments over kryptonite drawers to late-night teamwork that saves the world mid-dinner, every clash draws them closer to a rare, quiet truth: love doesn’t need perfection — only patience, coffee, and a place they can both call home. In the end, their greatest creation isn’t a new protocol or invention, but a simple, shared space between night and day.
